result.execSummary:
The defendant Edward W. Hatfield was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Seek and maintain full time employment.

Submit to DNA sample.  No contact with victims or their residences from the criminal complaint.  Compliance with CARE program and take any prescribed medication.  48 days credit if revoked.  Undergo any counseling per agent.    If probation/extended supervision revoked or discharges with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

timeConds.notes:
Total 1 year jail time.  60 days to commence on July 8, 2015.  Remaining 10 months jail stayed per compliance/completion of CARE program.   48 days credit if revoked.
Consecutive to: any other sentences or commitments.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Count 1 & 2:
4 years Probation, Concurrent to each other and any other probation term
Count 1:  1 year Sauk County Jail .  (60 days on or before July 8, 2015 at 6:30 p.m., remaining 10 months stayed with completion of CARE program)
DNA sample, unless already provided
No contact with victims in complaint or residences
Compliance with CARE program and take any prescribed medication
Seek and maintain full time employment.  
48 days credit if revoked.
Undergo any counseling per agent.
AODA & treatment
